greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of phi^3 = 2 + sqrt(5).
comment: This sequence is also the decimal expansion of ((1+sqrt(5))/2)^3. - _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Apr 14 2008
This is the length/width ratio of a 4-extension rectangle; see A188640 for definitions. - _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 10 2011
Its continued fraction is [4, 4, ...] (see A010709). - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 10 2011
Lim_{n -> infinity} F(n+3)/F(n) = lim_{n -> infinity} (1 + 2*F(n+1)/F(n)) = 2 + sqrt(5), with F(n) = A000045(n). - _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Mar 11 2012
Sum_{n>=1} n/phi^n = phi/(phi-1)^2 = phi^3. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Jun 29 2014
reference: Alexey Stakhov, The mathematics of harmony: from Euclid to contemporary mathematics and computer science, World Scientific, Singapore, 2009, p. 657.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: 2 plus the constant in A002163. - _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 02 2008
Equals exp(arcsinh(2)), since arcsinh(x) = log(x+sqrt(x^2+1)). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 01 2013
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Sep 02 2004
ext: Title expanded to include observation from _Mohammad K. Azarian_ by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 11 2012
